2. Henderson and Liverpool goalkeeper Simon Mignolet both played their 47th game of season in the win over Newcastle United.

explain: Jordan Henderson, the vice-captain of Liverpool, believes that his team has a chance of catching up with Manchester City in the Premier League this season. He made this statement after playing his 47th game of the season, along with Simon Mignolet, in their 2-0 win over Newcastle United on Monday night.

While the two players are not the only ones to have played 47 games this season, it is notable that they have reached this total specifically during the 47th game of the season. This could be seen as symbolic of their dedication and hard work, as well as their importance to the team. Additionally, it may suggest that they are well-rested and prepared for the upcoming games, which could give Liverpool an edge over their rivals.

Liverpool's 2-0 win over Newcastle on Monday night was an important result for the team as it helped regain their winning form after having faced two consecutive losses against Manchester United and Arsenal earlier this month.

Given that the aspect is about the current state of play of the two teams, specifically Liverpool and Manchester City, in the Premier League, the core idea being presented is that Liverpool are currently four points behind Manchester City.

Liverpool played well against Newcastle United and won 2-0. 

Describe the game briefly.
The game between Liverpool and Newcastle United was close and competitive, with both teams giving their all to come out on top. In the end, the Reds were able to claim victory, winning the game 2-0.

Describe the importance of the game.
The game against Newcastle United was vital for Liverpool as they look to challenge Manchester City for the Premier League title. A win would have brought them closer to the top of the table and given them confidence heading into their next matches.

Describe the key players.
Jordan Henderson and Simon Mignolet both played their 47th game of the season, showing their dedication and hard work towards the team's success. These two players are important to the team and their performance was key to Liverpool's victory.

The aspect highlights Liverpool's determination as they managed to score two goals against Newcastle United with both Jordan Henderson and Simon Mignolet playing their 47th game of the season. This indicates that the team is dedicated and well-prepared to compete against top teams like Manchester City in the Premier League.

The aspect states that even though Liverpool won the game against Newcastle with a score of 2-0, Newcastle had a strong shout for a penalty. This means that even though they may have lost the game, they had a valid argument for receiving a penalty kick during the match, which would have given them the opportunity to score a goal and potentially change the outcome of the game.
